dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits rivers, lakes or swamps.  Feed on small animals in the bottom sediments.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2013. Acanthopsoides molobrion. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
The species is known from southeast Asia, from the Malay Peninsula to Borneo. Records include Indonesia (throughout Kalimantan (Bo River, Mahakam River drainage; Kapuas River) and Sumatra (Riau and Musi rivers)), Malaysia (Sabah (Kinabatangan River), Sarawak (Baleh River; Rajang River (Parenti and Lim 2005)), and Peninsular Malaysia (Sungai Teragganu basin; Johor, near Bekok; Endau drainage (Ng and Tan 1999)), and southern peninsular Thailand (from the Tapi River southwards) (Siebert 1991). The species is present throughout Peninsular Malaysia, with the Tapi River in Thailand probably representing the species' northern-most distribution, although Monkolprasit et al. (1997) record the species from Surat Thani Province.

Vidthayanon et al. (1997) reported the species' presence in the Mekong system, but this is unlikely.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Malaysia and Borneo (Ref. 7050).  Recorded from  the Mekong basin (Ref. 26336).

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2013. Acanthopsoides molobrion. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
Allen, D.

Reviewer/s
Kottelat, M., Vidthayanon, C. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species has a wide distribution and is abundant where found. Confirmation is required of the taxonomic status of the species and sub-populations, as Rainboth (1996) considered it likely that the species is a synonym of Acanthopsoides hapalias Siebert 1991, as the species was differentiated from hapalias primarily by geographical distribution. Considered a valid species by subsequent authors, but Siebert (1991) suggests that the species may be a complex, and further taxonomic work is required. It is considered Least Concern at present however further taxonomic study is required to confirm the species' correct taxonomic placement, and its distribution if confirmed as a valid species.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Trends
dataObjects.title: Population
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2013. Acanthopsoides molobrion. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Population
It is widespread, but known from few records at each location (Siebert 1991), however it is abundant where found (M. Kottelat pers. comm. 2012).

Population Trend
Unknown
